meanings.definition: Lames (noun): plural form of lame, meaning someone who is uncool or boring.
meanings.sent1: The lames at the party just sat in the corner.
meanings.sent2: Don't be a lames, join in the fun!
meanings.sent3: The lames tried to dance but ended up looking silly.
meanings.sent4: The party was lively, but the lames brought a cloud of boredom.
meanings.sent5: Being a lames is like being stuck in a never-ending yawn.

meanings.definition: Lames (verb): third person singular present of lame, meaning to make someone or something uncool or boring.
meanings.sent1: She lames every joke with her serious attitude.
meanings.sent2: Please don't lames the party with your negativity.
meanings.sent3: He lames every movie by pointing out all the flaws.
meanings.sent4: Her criticism lames the excitement of any new idea.
meanings.sent5: His constant complaints lames the joy out of everything.
